title: Detect out of order fn arguments and suggest the correct order

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
fn foo(a: usize, b: f32) {}

fn main() {
    foo(0.1, 42);
}
```

[we currently emit](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=d672274b8b32822af37045b0b76ff9d7):

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:9
  |
4 |     foo(0.1, 42);
  |         ^^^ expected usize, found floating-point number
  |
  = note: expected type `usize`
             found type `{float}`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:14
  |
4 |     foo(0.1, 42);
  |              ^^
  |              |
  |              expected f32, found integer
  |              help: use a float literal: `42.0`
  |
  = note: expected type `f32`
             found type `{integer}`
```

It might make sense to be closer to:

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types in function arguments
 --> src/main.rs:4:9
  |
4 |     foo(0.1, 42);
  |         ^^^  ^^ expected f32, found integer
  |         |
  |         expected usize, found floating-point number
  |
  = note: expected types `usize`
                         `f32`
             found types `{float}`
                         `{integer}`
help: you might have used an incorrect order for the arguments:
  |
4 |     foo(42, 0.1);
  |         ^^  ^^^
```

The suggestion should only be done when there's a high likelihood that the order of the arguments is simply incorrect:

 - the amount of args is correct
 - the types are all unique
 - other restrictions?
